wiki.content: "Crash Into Me" is from the Dave Matthews Band's album "Crash;" it is also found on the band's first compilation album: The Best of What's Around, Vol. 1. "Crash Into Me" reached #7 on billboard's modern rock chart in March, 1997. Although it didn't win, the song was nominated for a 1998 grammy for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals. It has since been covered by a number of artists, including Stevie Nicks. Dave Matthews has described the song as being about a voyeur's worship of women and that he wrote the song instead of being arrested. (VHI Storytellers). User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Crash Into Me" is from the Dave Matthews Band's album "Crash;" it is also found on the band's first compilation album: The Best of What's Around, Vol. 1. "Crash Into Me" reached #7 on billboard's modern rock chart in March, 1997. Although it didn't win, the song was nominated for a 1998 grammy for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals. It has since been covered by a number of artists, including Stevie Nicks. Dave Matthews has described the song as being about a voyeur's worship of women and that he wrote the song instead of being arrested. (VHI Storytellers).
